meanings.definition: A flock of sheep or birds.
meanings.sent1: The hirsel of birds flew gracefully across the sky.
meanings.sent2: We saw a large hirsel of sheep grazing in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The noisy hirsel of birds woke me up early in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The hirsel of sheep resembled a fluffy white cloud on the hill.
meanings.sent5: The colorful hirsel of birds painted the sky with their wings.

meanings.definition: To manage or tend a flock of sheep or birds.
meanings.sent1: The shepherd would hirsel the sheep to greener pastures.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to hirsel the birds to their nests every evening.
meanings.sent3: I tried to hirsel the sheep into the pen, but they kept running away.
meanings.sent4: He hirseled the flock with care, ensuring they were safe from predators.
meanings.sent5: The farmer hirselled the birds away from his crops to protect them.
